title: How we insert image in text areas in HTML? - Quora

response.answer_text: On the off chance that you want to actually insert an image into a textarea tag, I'm going to suggest that you either place the image next to the textarea, or use the contenteditable attribute and some JavaScript to allow the user to edit a paragraph which wraps an image, then submit the edited value of the paragraph as you would a textarea.

I am guessing you want to know how to insert img to a webpage. If so, there’s an html image element() to use.  The src attributes, is source of your file. And the alt attribute the alternative text to display incase image source is missing. I am curious as to why you ask such a question anyway. If you know what html is, my guess is you should know it’s made of tags call html elements.
